oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Development of SAR interferometry at IIT Bombay
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SUKHATME, JS
WALAVALKAR, V
RAO, YS
VENKATARAMAN, G
KHIRE, MV
RAO, KS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: geophysical signal processing
geophysical techniques
radar imaging
radar signal processing
remote sensing by radar
spaceborne radar
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The emphasis of this paper is on the implementation of SAR inteferometry at CSRE, Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay. ISAR software by ESA was used for generating the fringes and the phase unwrapping software was developed in-house. A test site around the Western Ghats was chosen for testing the software.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Proceedings of the IEEE International Geoscience and Remote Sensing Symposium Remote Sensing for a Sustainable Future (V 1), Lincoln, USA, 27-31 May 1996, 430 - 432
